title: Senators: It's 'immoral and irresponsible' not to vaccinate migrants in CBP custody
text:
(CNN) It's "immoral and irresponsible" not to vaccinate migrants in the custody of US Customs and Border Protection against flu, said a letter sent Friday from 13 US senators to US Department of Homeland Security Acting Secretary Kevin McAleenan and US Department of Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar.

Three children who had been in US custody have died after contracting flu.

The decision not to vaccinate is "placing entire communities at risk of the flu and its associated complications," the letter said. The decision "could make wider flu outbreaks more likely," and that could put government workers and the American public at risk, according to the letter, signed by 13 Democratic senators.

CBP has not responded to a CNN email requesting comment.

The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommends that all people older than the age of 6 months get a flu vaccine by the end of October. Typically, the flu season begins to intensify around then. Many US pharmacies already have the vaccine available.
